title: Warren Hoge, Who Covered Wars and World Crises for The Times, Dies at 82
description: As a correspondent, including as a bureau chief, he wrote vividly from all corners of the globe. He later served as foreign editor and assistant managing editor.

title: Thursday Briefing: Prigozhin Listed Aboard Crashed Plane
description: Also, a paralyzed woman regains her voice.

title: How Multiple Warnings About Killer Nurse Lucy Letby Were Missed
description: Since the trial of Lucy Letby, a nurse who murdered babies in her care, experts have warned of a culture of hostility toward whistle-blowers in Britain’s National Health Service.

title: Atop an Underwater Hot Spring, an ‘Octopus Garden’ Thrives
description: The heat, a new study suggests, makes for an ideal breeding ground for these eight-legged animals.

title: Toto Cutugno, Singer Whose ‘L’Italiano’ Struck a Chord, Dies at 80
description: The nostalgic ballads and catchy pop songs he wrote paved the way for an international career. He sold more than 100 million albums worldwide.

title: In Photos: Greece’s Catastrophic Wildfires
description: Firefighters are struggling to quell deadly flames, part of a crisis of wildfires in the nation this summer. Here are photos from the latest blazes.

title: BRICS May Add More Countries to the Group. Here’s What to Know.
description: Saudi Arabia, Argentina, Indonesia and Egypt are among the potential candidates to expand the five-nation bloc, many of them seeking stronger ties with non-Western powers. Iran is also interested.

title: Greece Battles Its Most Widespread Wildfires on Record
description: Extreme heat has turned much of the country into a tinderbox. More than 350 fires have broken out in the past five days, the government said.

title: Putin Again Blames West for Ukraine War In Speech to BRICS Summit
description: President Vladimir V. Putin said Russia would assume chairmanship of the group made up of Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa next year and host a summit in the city of Kazan in October 2024.

title: Manliness, Prestige and Cash: How Military Service Is Sold on Russian TV
description: The Times tracked several months of Russian state messaging in the Kremlin’s effort to recruit soldiers.

title: Russia Says Ukrainian Drones Targeted Moscow for a Sixth Consecutive Day
description: Drone attacks in Russian territory have become more frequent as Ukraine wages its grueling counteroffensive.

title: At Least 17 Die as Bridge Collapses While Under Construction in India
description: A rescue effort was underway as reports indicated that several additional workers were trapped under the wreckage.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russian General Relieved of Duties After Failed Mutiny
description: Gen. Sergei Surovikin was removed from his post as chief of the air force, state media reported. He had ties to the leader of the Wagner mercenary group that mounted the short-lived rebellion in June.

title: Manliness, Prestige and Cash: How Military Service Is Sold on Russian TV
description: The Times tracked several months of Russian state messaging in the Kremlin’s effort to recruit soldiers.

title: In the Heart of the Australian Outback, Safeguarding a Sacred Land
description: On a road trip in central Australia, a visitor learns how Indigenous custodians and conservationists are working to protect an ancient land and its animal denizens.

title: China Works to Expand its Sway in Africa Amid Rivalry With the U.S.
description: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, pitches his country as a leader of the developing world, rallying support for an alternative to the U.S.-dominated global order.

title: What to Know About Zimbabwe’s Presidential Election
description: The country needs a free and fair election to escape Western sanctions. But familiar concerns about government repression and ballot rigging are dogging the vote.
